channel.title: Archlinux on The Plone Expanse
channel.description: Recent content in Archlinux on The Plone Expanse

item.title: How I broke my archlinux and fixed it
item.description: Today, new lesson learnt. I needed to test something with Internet Explorer and Edge, so I’ve downloaded the test images from the Microsoft website, then proceeded to install virtualbox, in my current KDE based ArchLinux desktop (which I love a lot). A simple pacman -S virtualbox perhaps? Yes, except… After installing virtualbox, it complained about some missing libssl2.0.0 lib… so I thought maybe I don’t have that installed? I didn’t really research it, just installed openssl.
